text: The beginning of the gospel of Jesus Christ, the Son of God.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
The voice of one crying in the wilderness,
‘Make ready the way of the Lord,
Make His paths straight.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: John the Baptist appeared in the wilderness preaching a baptism of repentance for the forgiveness of sins.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the country of Judea was going out to him, and all the people of Jerusalem; and they were being baptized by him in the Jordan River, confessing their sins.
speaker: Narrator

text: John was clothed with camel’s hair and wore a leather belt around his waist, and his diet was locusts and wild honey.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he was preaching, and saying, “After me One is coming who is mightier than I, and I am not fit to stoop down and untie the thong of His sandals.
speaker: Narrator

text: I baptized you with water; but He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit.”
speaker: Narrator

text: In those days Jesus came from Nazareth in Galilee and was baptized by John in the Jordan.
speaker: Narrator

text: Immediately coming up out of the water, He saw the heavens opening, and the Spirit like a dove descending upon Him;
speaker: Narrator

text: and a voice came out of the heavens: “You are My beloved Son, in You I am well-pleased.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Immediately the Spirit impelled Him to go out into the wilderness.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He was in the wilderness forty days being tempted by Satan; and He was with the wild beasts, and the angels were ministering to Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now after John had been taken into custody, Jesus came into Galilee, preaching the gospel of God,
speaker: Narrator

text: and saying, “The time is fulfilled, and the kingdom of God is at hand; repent and believe in the gospel.”
speaker: Jesus

text: As He was going along by the Sea of Galilee, He saw Simon and Andrew, the brother of Simon, casting a net in the sea; for they were fishermen.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus said to them, “Follow Me, and I will make you become fishers of men.”
speaker: Jesus

text: Immediately they left their nets and followed Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Going on a little farther, He saw James the son of Zebedee, and John his brother, who were also in the boat mending the nets.
speaker: Narrator

text: Immediately He called them; and they left their father Zebedee in the boat with the hired servants, and went away to follow Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: They went into Capernaum; and immediately on the Sabbath He entered the synagogue and began to teach.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were amazed at His teaching; for He was teaching them as one having authority, and not as the scribes.
speaker: Narrator

text: Just then there was a man in their synagogue with an unclean spirit; and he cried out,
speaker: Narrator

text: saying, “What business do we have with each other, Jesus of Nazareth? Have You come to destroy us? I know who You are—the Holy One of God!”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus rebuked him, saying, “Be quiet, and come out of him!”
speaker: Jesus

text: Throwing him into convulsions, the unclean spirit cried out with a loud voice and came out of him.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were all amazed, so that they debated among themselves, saying, “What is this? A new teaching with authority! He commands even the unclean spirits, and they obey Him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Immediately the news about Him spread everywhere into all the surrounding district of Galilee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And immediately after they came out of the synagogue, they came into the house of Simon and Andrew, with James and John.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Simon’s mother-in-law was lying sick with a fever; and immediately they spoke to Jesus about her.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He came to her and raised her up, taking her by the hand, and the fever left her, and she waited on them.
speaker: Narrator

text: When evening came, after the sun had set, they began bringing to Him all who were ill and those who were demon-possessed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the whole city had gathered at the door.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He healed many who were ill with various diseases, and cast out many demons; and He was not permitting the demons to speak, because they knew who He was.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the early morning, while it was still dark, Jesus got up, left the house, and went away to a secluded place, and was praying there.
speaker: Narrator

text: Simon and his companions searched for Him;
speaker: Narrator

text: they found Him, and said to Him, “Everyone is looking for You.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to them, “Let us go somewhere else to the towns nearby, so that I may preach there also; for that is what I came for.”
speaker: Jesus

text: And He went into their synagogues throughout all Galilee, preaching and casting out the demons.
speaker: Narrator

text: And a leper came to Jesus, beseeching Him and falling on his knees before Him, and saying, “If You are willing, You can make me clean.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moved with compassion, Jesus stretched out His hand and touched him, and said to him, “I am willing; be cleansed.”
speaker: Jesus

text: Immediately the leprosy left him and he was cleansed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He sternly warned him and immediately sent him away,
speaker: Narrator

text: and He said to him, “See that you say nothing to anyone; but go, show yourself to the priest and offer for your cleansing what Moses commanded, as a testimony to them.”
speaker: Jesus

text: But he went out and began to proclaim it freely and to spread the news around, to such an extent that Jesus could no longer publicly enter a city, but stayed out in unpopulated areas; and they were coming to Him from everywhere.
speaker: Narrator

text: When He had come back to Capernaum several days afterward, it was heard that He was at home.
speaker: Narrator

text: And many were gathered together, so that there was no longer room, not even near the door; and He was speaking the word to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they came, bringing to Him a paralytic, carried by four men.
speaker: Narrator

text: Being unable to get to Him because of the crowd, they removed the roof above Him; and when they had dug an opening, they let down the pallet on which the paralytic was lying.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus seeing their faith said to the paralytic, “Son, your sins are forgiven.”
speaker: Jesus

text: But some of the scribes were sitting there and reasoning in their hearts,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Why does this man speak that way? He is blaspheming; who can forgive sins but God alone?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Immediately Jesus, aware in His spirit that they were reasoning that way within themselves, said to them, “Why are you reasoning about these things in your hearts?
speaker: Jesus

text: Which is easier, to say to the paralytic, ‘Your sins are forgiven’; or to say, ‘Get up, and pick up your pallet and walk’?
speaker: Jesus

text: But so that you may know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins”—He said to the paralytic,
speaker: Jesus

text: “I say to you, get up, pick up your pallet and go home.”
speaker: Jesus

text: And he got up and immediately picked up the pallet and went out in the sight of everyone, so that they were all amazed and were glorifying God, saying, “We have never seen anything like this.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He went out again by the seashore; and all the people were coming to Him, and He was teaching them.
speaker: Narrator

text: As He passed by, He saw Levi the son of Alphaeus sitting in the tax booth, and He said to him, “Follow Me!” And he got up and followed Him.
speaker: Jesus

text: And it happened that He was reclining at the table in his house, and many tax collectors and sinners were dining with Jesus and His disciples; for there were many of them, and they were following Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the scribes of the Pharisees saw that He was eating with the sinners and tax collectors, they said to His disciples, “Why is He eating and drinking with tax collectors and sinners?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And hearing this, Jesus said to them, “It is not those who are healthy who need a physician, but those who are sick; I did not come to call the righteous, but sinners.”
speaker: Jesus

text: John’s disciples and the Pharisees were fasting; and they came and said to Him, “Why do John’s disciples and the disciples of the Pharisees fast, but Your disciples do not fast?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus said to them, “While the bridegroom is with them, the attendants of the bridegroom cannot fast, can they? So long as they have the bridegroom with them, they cannot fast.
speaker: Jesus

text: But the days will come when the bridegroom is taken away from them, and then they will fast in that day.
speaker: Jesus

text: “No one sews a patch of unshrunk cloth on an old garment; otherwise the patch pulls away from it, the new from the old, and a worse tear results.
speaker: Narrator

text: No one puts new wine into old wineskins; otherwise the wine will burst the skins, and the wine is lost and the skins as well; but one puts new wine into fresh wineskins.”
speaker: Jesus

text: And it happened that He was passing through the grainfields on the Sabbath, and His disciples began to make their way along while picking the heads of grain.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Pharisees were saying to Him, “Look, why are they doing what is not lawful on the Sabbath?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said to them, “Have you never read what David did when he was in need and he and his companions became hungry;
speaker: Jesus

text: how he entered the house of God in the time of Abiathar the high priest, and ate the consecrated bread, which is not lawful for anyone to eat except the priests, and he also gave it to those who were with him?”
speaker: Jesus

text: Jesus said to them, “The Sabbath was made for man, and not man for the Sabbath.
speaker: Jesus

text: So the Son of Man is Lord even of the Sabbath.”
speaker: Jesus

text: He entered again into a synagogue; and a man was there whose hand was withered.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were watching Him to see if He would heal him on the Sabbath, so that they might accuse Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to the man with the withered hand, “Get up and come forward!”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said to them, “Is it lawful to do good or to do harm on the Sabbath, to save a life or to kill?” But they kept silent.
speaker: Narrator

text: After looking around at them with anger, grieved at their hardness of heart, He said to the man, “Stretch out your hand.” And he stretched it out, and his hand was restored.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Pharisees went out and immediately began conspiring with the Herodians against Him, as to how they might destroy Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus withdrew to the sea with His disciples; and a great multitude from Galilee followed; and also from Judea,
speaker: Narrator

text: and from Jerusalem, and from Idumea, and beyond the Jordan, and the vicinity of Tyre and Sidon, a great number of people heard of all that He was doing and came to Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He told His disciples that a boat should stand ready for Him because of the crowd, so that they would not crowd Him;
speaker: Narrator

text: for He had healed many, with the result that all those who had afflictions pressed around Him in order to touch Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whenever the unclean spirits saw Him, they would fall down before Him and shout, “You are the Son of God!”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He earnestly warned them not to tell who He was.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He went up on the mountain and summoned those whom He Himself wanted, and they came to Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He appointed twelve, so that they would be with Him and that He could send them out to preach,
speaker: Narrator

text: and to have authority to cast out the demons.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He appointed the twelve: Simon (to whom He gave the name Peter),
speaker: Narrator

text: and James, the son of Zebedee, and John the brother of James (to them He gave the name Boanerges, which means, “Sons of Thunder”);
speaker: Narrator

text: and Andrew, and Philip, and Bartholomew, and Matthew, and Thomas, and James the son of Alphaeus, and Thaddaeus, and Simon the Zealot;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Judas Iscariot, who betrayed Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He came home, and the crowd gathered again, to such an extent that they could not even eat a meal.
speaker: Narrator

text: When His own people heard of this, they went out to take custody of Him; for they were saying, “He has lost His senses.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The scribes who came down from Jerusalem were saying, “He is possessed by Beelzebul,” and “He casts out the demons by the ruler of the demons.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He called them to Himself and began speaking to them in parables, “How can Satan cast out Satan?
speaker: Narrator

text: If a kingdom is divided against itself, that kingdom cannot stand.
speaker: Narrator

text: If a house is divided against itself, that house will not be able to stand.
speaker: Narrator

text: If Satan has risen up against himself and is divided, he cannot stand, but he is finished!
speaker: Narrator

text: But no one can enter the strong man’s house and plunder his property unless he first binds the strong man, and then he will plunder his house.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Truly I say to you, all sins shall be forgiven the sons of men, and whatever blasphemies they utter;
speaker: Narrator

text: but whoever blasphemes against the Holy Spirit never has forgiveness, but is guilty of an eternal sin”—
speaker: Narrator

text: because they were saying, “He has an unclean spirit.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then His mother and His brothers arrived, and standing outside they sent word to Him and called Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: A crowd was sitting around Him, and they said to Him, “Behold, Your mother and Your brothers are outside looking for You.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Answering them, He said, “Who are My mother and My brothers?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Looking about at those who were sitting around Him, He said, “Behold My mother and My brothers!
speaker: Narrator

text: For whoever does the will of God, he is My brother and sister and mother.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He began to teach again by the sea. And such a very large crowd gathered to Him that He got into a boat in the sea and sat down; and the whole crowd was by the sea on the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He was teaching them many things in parables, and was saying to them in His teaching,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Listen to this! Behold, the sower went out to sow;
speaker: Narrator

text: as he was sowing, some seed fell beside the road, and the birds came and ate it up.
speaker: Narrator

text: Other seed fell on the rocky ground where it did not have much soil; and immediately it sprang up because it had no depth of soil.
speaker: Narrator

text: And after the sun had risen, it was scorched; and because it had no root, it withered away.
speaker: Narrator

text: Other seed fell among the thorns, and the thorns came up and choked it, and it yielded no crop.
speaker: Narrator

text: Other seeds fell into the good soil, and as they grew up and increased, they yielded a crop and produced thirty, sixty, and a hundredfold.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He was saying, “He who has ears to hear, let him hear.”
speaker: Narrator

text: As soon as He was alone, His followers, along with the twelve, began asking Him about the parables.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He was saying to them, “To you has been given the mystery of the kingdom of God, but those who are outside get everything in parables,
speaker: Narrator

text: so that while seeing, they may see and not perceive, and while hearing, they may hear and not understand, otherwise they might return and be forgiven.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said to them, “Do you not understand this parable? How will you understand all the parables?
speaker: Narrator

text: The sower sows the word.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the ones who are beside the road where the word is sown; and when they hear, immediately Satan comes and takes away the word which has been sown in them.
speaker: Narrator

text: In a similar way these are the ones on whom seed was sown on the rocky places, who, when they hear the word, immediately receive it with joy;
speaker: Narrator

text: and they have no firm root in themselves, but are only temporary; then, when affliction or persecution arises because of the word, immediately they fall away.
speaker: Narrator

text: And others are the ones on whom seed was sown among the thorns; these are the ones who have heard the word,
speaker: Narrator

text: but the worries of the world, and the deceitfulness of riches, and the desires for other things enter in and choke the word, and it becomes unfruitful.
speaker: Narrator

text: And those are the ones on whom seed was sown on the good soil; and they hear the word and accept it and bear fruit, thirty, sixty, and a hundredfold.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He was saying to them, “A lamp is not brought to be put under a basket, is it, or under a bed? Is it not brought to be put on the lampstand?
speaker: Narrator

text: For nothing is hidden, except to be revealed; nor has anything been secret, but that it would come to light.
speaker: Narrator

text: If anyone has ears to hear, let him hear.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He was saying to them, “Take care what you listen to. By your standard of measure it will be measured to you; and more will be given you besides.
speaker: Narrator

text: For whoever has, to him more shall be given; and whoever does not have, even what he has shall be taken away from him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He was saying, “The kingdom of God is like a man who casts seed upon the soil;
speaker: Narrator

text: and he goes to bed at night and gets up by day, and the seed sprouts and grows—how, he himself does not know.
speaker: Narrator

text: The soil produces crops by itself; first the blade, then the head, then the mature grain in the head.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when the crop permits, he immediately puts in the sickle, because the harvest has come.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said, “How shall we picture the kingdom of God, or by what parable shall we present it?
speaker: Narrator

text: It is like a mustard seed, which, when sown upon the soil, though it is smaller than all the seeds that are upon the soil,
speaker: Narrator

text: yet when it is sown, it grows up and becomes larger than all the garden plants and forms large branches; so that the birds of the air can nest under its shade.”
speaker: Narrator

text: With many such parables He was speaking the word to them, so far as they were able to hear it;
speaker: Narrator

text: and He did not speak to them without a parable; but He was explaining everything privately to His own disciples.
speaker: Narrator

text: On that day, when evening came, He said to them, “Let us go over to the other side.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Leaving the crowd, they took Him along with them in the boat, just as He was; and other boats were with Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there arose a fierce gale of wind, and the waves were breaking over the boat so much that the boat was already filling up.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus Himself was in the stern, asleep on the cushion; and they woke Him and said to Him, “Teacher, do You not care that we are perishing?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He got up and rebuked the wind and said to the sea, “Hush, be still.” And the wind died down and it became perfectly calm.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said to them, “Why are you afraid? Do you still have no faith?”
speaker: Narrator

text: They became very much afraid and said to one another, “Who then is this, that even the wind and the sea obey Him?”
speaker: Narrator

text: They came to the other side of the sea, into the country of the Gerasenes.
speaker: Narrator

text: When He got out of the boat, immediately a man from the tombs with an unclean spirit met Him,
speaker: Narrator

text: and he had his dwelling among the tombs. And no one was able to bind him anymore, even with a chain;
speaker: Narrator

text: because he had often been bound with shackles and chains, and the chains had been torn apart by him and the shackles broken in pieces, and no one was strong enough to subdue him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Constantly, night and day, he was screaming among the tombs and in the mountains, and gashing himself with stones.
speaker: Narrator

text: Seeing Jesus from a distance, he ran up and bowed down before Him;
speaker: Narrator

text: and shouting with a loud voice, he said, “What business do we have with each other, Jesus, Son of the Most High God? I implore You by God, do not torment me!”
speaker: Narrator

text: For He had been saying to him, “Come out of the man, you unclean spirit!”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He was asking him, “What is your name?” And he said to Him, “My name is Legion; for we are many.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he began to implore Him earnestly not to send them out of the country.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now there was a large herd of swine feeding nearby on the mountain.
speaker: Narrator

text: The demons implored Him, saying, “Send us into the swine so that we may enter them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus gave them permission. And coming out, the unclean spirits entered the swine; and the herd rushed down the steep bank into the sea, about two thousand of them; and they were drowned in the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their herdsmen ran away and reported it in the city and in the country. And the people came to see what it was that had happened.
speaker: Narrator

text: They came to Jesus and observed the man who had been demon-possessed sitting down, clothed and in his right mind, the very man who had had the “legion”; and they became frightened.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who had seen it described to them how it had happened to the demon-possessed man, and all about the swine.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they began to implore Him to leave their region.
speaker: Narrator

text: As He was getting into the boat, the man who had been demon-possessed was imploring Him that he might accompany Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He did not let him, but He said to him, “Go home to your people and report to them what great things the Lord has done for you, and how He had mercy on you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he went away and began to proclaim in Decapolis what great things Jesus had done for him; and everyone was amazed.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus had crossed over again in the boat to the other side, a large crowd gathered around Him; and so He stayed by the seashore.
speaker: Narrator

text: One of the synagogue officials named Jairus came up, and on seeing Him, fell at His feet
speaker: Narrator

text: and implored Him earnestly, saying, “My little daughter is at the point of death; please come and lay Your hands on her, so that she will get well and live.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He went off with him; and a large crowd was following Him and pressing in on Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: A woman who had had a hemorrhage for twelve years,
speaker: Narrator

text: and had endured much at the hands of many physicians, and had spent all that she had and was not helped at all, but rather had grown worse—
speaker: Narrator

text: after hearing about Jesus, she came up in the crowd behind Him and touched His cloak.
speaker: Narrator

text: For she thought, “If I just touch His garments, I will get well.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Immediately the flow of her blood was dried up; and she felt in her body that she was healed of her affliction.
speaker: Narrator

text: Immediately Jesus, perceiving in Himself that the power proceeding from Him had gone forth, turned around in the crowd and said, “Who touched My garments?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And His disciples said to Him, “You see the crowd pressing in on You, and You say, ‘Who touched Me?’”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He looked around to see the woman who had done this.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the woman fearing and trembling, aware of what had happened to her, came and fell down before Him and told Him the whole truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said to her, “Daughter, your faith has made you well; go in peace and be healed of your affliction.”
speaker: Narrator

text: While He was still speaking, they came from the house of the synagogue official, saying, “Your daughter has died; why trouble the Teacher anymore?”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus, overhearing what was being spoken, said to the synagogue official, “Do not be afraid any longer, only believe.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He allowed no one to accompany Him, except Peter and James and John the brother of James.
speaker: Narrator

text: They came to the house of the synagogue official; and He saw a commotion, and people loudly weeping and wailing.
speaker: Narrator

text: And entering in, He said to them, “Why make a commotion and weep? The child has not died, but is asleep.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They began laughing at Him. But putting them all out, He took along the child’s father and mother and His own companions, and entered the room where the child was.
speaker: Narrator

text: Taking the child by the hand, He said to her, “Talitha kum!” (which translated means, “Little girl, I say to you, get up!”).
speaker: Narrator

text: Immediately the girl got up and began to walk, for she was twelve years old. And immediately they were completely astounded.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He gave them strict orders that no one should know about this, and He said that something should be given her to eat.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus went out from there and came into His hometown; and His disciples followed Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the Sabbath came, He began to teach in the synagogue; and the many listeners were astonished, saying, “Where did this man get these things, and what is this wisdom given to Him, and such miracles as these performed by His hands?
speaker: Narrator

text: Is not this the carpenter, the son of Mary, and brother of James and Joses and Judas and Simon? Are not His sisters here with us?” And they took offense at Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to them, “A prophet is not without honor except in his hometown and among his own relatives and in his own household.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He could do no miracle there except that He laid His hands on a few sick people and healed them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And He wondered at their unbelief.
And He was going around the villages teaching.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He summoned the twelve and began to send them out in pairs, and gave them authority over the unclean spirits;
speaker: Narrator

text: and He instructed them that they should take nothing for their journey, except a mere staff—no bread, no bag, no money in their belt—
speaker: Narrator

text: but to wear sandals; and He added, “Do not put on two tunics.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said to them, “Wherever you enter a house, stay there until you leave town.
speaker: Narrator

text: Any place that does not receive you or listen to you, as you go out from there, shake the dust off the soles of your feet for a testimony against them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They went out and preached that men should repent.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they were casting out many demons and were anointing with oil many sick people and healing them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And King Herod heard of it, for His name had become well known; and people were saying, “John the Baptist has risen from the dead, and that is why these miraculous powers are at work in Him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But others were saying, “He is Elijah.” And others were saying, “He is a prophet, like one of the prophets of old.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But when Herod heard of it, he kept saying, “John, whom I beheaded, has risen!”
speaker: Narrator

text: For Herod himself had sent and had John arrested and bound in prison on account of Herodias, the wife of his brother Philip, because he had married her.
speaker: Narrator

text: For John had been saying to Herod, “It is not lawful for you to have your brother’s wife.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Herodias had a grudge against him and wanted to put him to death and could not do so;
speaker: Narrator

text: for Herod was afraid of John, knowing that he was a righteous and holy man, and he kept him safe. And when he heard him, he was very perplexed; but he used to enjoy listening to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: A strategic day came when Herod on his birthday gave a banquet for his lords and military commanders and the leading men of Galilee;
speaker: Narrator

text: and when the daughter of Herodias herself came in and danced, she pleased Herod and his dinner guests; and the king said to the girl, “Ask me for whatever you want and I will give it to you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he swore to her, “Whatever you ask of me, I will give it to you; up to half of my kingdom.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And she went out and said to her mother, “What shall I ask for?” And she said, “The head of John the Baptist.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Immediately she came in a hurry to the king and asked, saying, “I want you to give me at once the head of John the Baptist on a platter.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And although the king was very sorry, yet because of his oaths and because of his dinner guests, he was unwilling to refuse her.
speaker: Narrator

text: Immediately the king sent an executioner and commanded him to bring back his head. And he went and had him beheaded in the prison,
speaker: Narrator

text: and brought his head on a platter, and gave it to the girl; and the girl gave it to her mother.
speaker: Narrator

text: When his disciples heard about this, they came and took away his body and laid it in a tomb.
speaker: Narrator

text: The apostles gathered together with Jesus; and they reported to Him all that they had done and taught.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said to them, “Come away by yourselves to a secluded place and rest a while.” (For there were many people coming and going, and they did not even have time to eat.)
speaker: Narrator

text: They went away in the boat to a secluded place by themselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: The people saw them going, and many recognized them and ran there together on foot from all the cities, and got there ahead of them.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus went ashore, He saw a large crowd, and He felt compassion for them because they were like sheep without a shepherd; and He began to teach them many things.
speaker: Narrator

text: When it was already quite late, His disciples came to Him and said, “This place is desolate and it is already quite late;
speaker: Narrator

text: send them away so that they may go into the surrounding countryside and villages and buy themselves something to eat.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But He answered them, “You give them something to eat!” And they said to Him, “Shall we go and spend two hundred denarii on bread and give them something to eat?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said to them, “How many loaves do you have? Go look!” And when they found out, they said, “Five, and two fish.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He commanded them all to sit down by groups on the green grass.
speaker: Narrator

text: They sat down in groups of hundreds and of fifties.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He took the five loaves and the two fish, and looking up toward heaven, He blessed the food and broke the loaves and He kept giving them to the disciples to set before them; and He divided up the two fish among them all.
speaker: Narrator

text: They all ate and were satisfied,
speaker: Narrator

text: and they picked up twelve full baskets of the broken pieces, and also of the fish.
speaker: Narrator

text: There were five thousand men who ate the loaves.
speaker: Narrator

text: Immediately Jesus made His disciples get into the boat and go ahead of Him to the other side to Bethsaida, while He Himself was sending the crowd away.
speaker: Narrator

text: After bidding them farewell, He left for the mountain to pray.
speaker: Narrator

text: When it was evening, the boat was in the middle of the sea, and He was alone on the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: Seeing them straining at the oars, for the wind was against them, at about the fourth watch of the night He came to them, walking on the sea; and He intended to pass by them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when they saw Him walking on the sea, they supposed that it was a ghost, and cried out;
speaker: Narrator

text: for they all saw Him and were terrified. But immediately He spoke with them and said to them, “Take courage; it is I, do not be afraid.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then He got into the boat with them, and the wind stopped; and they were utterly astonished,
speaker: Narrator

text: for they had not gained any insight from the incident of the loaves, but their heart was hardened.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they had crossed over they came to land at Gennesaret, and moored to the shore.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they got out of the boat, immediately the people recognized Him,
speaker: Narrator

text: and ran about that whole country and began to carry here and there on their pallets those who were sick, to the place they heard He was.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wherever He entered villages, or cities, or countryside, they were laying the sick in the market places, and imploring Him that they might just touch the fringe of His cloak; and as many as touched it were being cured.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Pharisees and some of the scribes gathered around Him when they had come from Jerusalem,
speaker: Narrator

text: and had seen that some of His disciples were eating their bread with impure hands, that is, unwashed.
speaker: Narrator

text: (For the Pharisees and all the Jews do not eat unless they carefully wash their hands, thus observing the traditions of the elders;
speaker: Narrator

text: and when they come from the market place, they do not eat unless they cleanse themselves; and there are many other things which they have received in order to observe, such as the washing of cups and pitchers and copper pots.)
speaker: Narrator

text: The Pharisees and the scribes asked Him, “Why do Your disciples not walk according to the tradition of the elders, but eat their bread with impure hands?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
And He said to them, “Rightly did Isaiah prophesy of you hypocrites, as it is written:
‘This people honors Me with their lips,
But their heart is far away from Me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
‘But in vain do they worship Me,
Teaching as doctrines the precepts of men.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Neglecting the commandment of God, you hold to the tradition of men.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He was also saying to them, “You are experts at setting aside the commandment of God in order to keep your tradition.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Moses said, ‘Honor your father and your mother’; and, ‘He who speaks evil of father or mother, is to be put to death’;
speaker: Narrator

text: but you say, ‘If a man says to his father or his mother, whatever I have that would help you is Corban (that is to say, given to God),’
speaker: Narrator

text: you no longer permit him to do anything for his father or his mother;
speaker: Narrator

text: thus invalidating the word of God by your tradition which you have handed down; and you do many things such as that.”
speaker: Narrator

text: After He called the crowd to Him again, He began saying to them, “Listen to Me, all of you, and understand:
speaker: Narrator

text: there is nothing outside the man which can defile him if it goes into him; but the things which proceed out of the man are what defile the man.
speaker: Narrator

text: [If anyone has ears to hear, let him hear.”]
speaker: Narrator

text: When he had left the crowd and entered the house, His disciples questioned Him about the parable.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said to them, “Are you so lacking in understanding also? Do you not understand that whatever goes into the man from outside cannot defile him,
speaker: Narrator

text: because it does not go into his heart, but into his stomach, and is eliminated?” (Thus He declared all foods clean.)
speaker: Narrator

text: And He was saying, “That which proceeds out of the man, that is what defiles the man.
speaker: Narrator

text: For from within, out of the heart of men, proceed the evil thoughts, fornications, thefts, murders, adulteries,
speaker: Narrator

text: deeds of coveting and wickedness, as well as deceit, sensuality, envy, slander, pride and foolishness.
speaker: Narrator

text: All these evil things proceed from within and defile the man.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus got up and went away from there to the region of Tyre. And when He had entered a house, He wanted no one to know of it; yet He could not escape notice.
speaker: Narrator

text: But after hearing of Him, a woman whose little daughter had an unclean spirit immediately came and fell at His feet.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the woman was a Gentile, of the Syrophoenician race. And she kept asking Him to cast the demon out of her daughter.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He was saying to her, “Let the children be satisfied first, for it is not good to take the children’s bread and throw it to the dogs.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But she answered and said to Him, “Yes, Lord, but even the dogs under the table feed on the children’s crumbs.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said to her, “Because of this answer go; the demon has gone out of your daughter.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And going back to her home, she found the child lying on the bed, the demon having left.
speaker: Narrator

text: Again He went out from the region of Tyre, and came through Sidon to the Sea of Galilee, within the region of Decapolis.
speaker: Narrator

text: They brought to Him one who was deaf and spoke with difficulty, and they implored Him to lay His hand on him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus took him aside from the crowd, by himself, and put His fingers into his ears, and after spitting, He touched his tongue with the saliva;
speaker: Narrator

text: and looking up to heaven with a deep sigh, He said to him, “Ephphatha!” that is, “Be opened!”
speaker: Narrator

text: And his ears were opened, and the impediment of his tongue was removed, and he began speaking plainly.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He gave them orders not to tell anyone; but the more He ordered them, the more widely they continued to proclaim it.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were utterly astonished, saying, “He has done all things well; He makes even the deaf to hear and the mute to speak.”
speaker: Narrator

text: In those days, when there was again a large crowd and they had nothing to eat, Jesus called His disciples and said to them,
speaker: Narrator

text: “I feel compassion for the people because they have remained with Me now three days and have nothing to eat.
speaker: Narrator

text: If I send them away hungry to their homes, they will faint on the way; and some of them have come from a great distance.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And His disciples answered Him, “Where will anyone be able to find enough bread here in this desolate place to satisfy these people?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He was asking them, “How many loaves do you have?” And they said, “Seven.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He directed the people to sit down on the ground; and taking the seven loaves, He gave thanks and broke them, and started giving them to His disciples to serve to them, and they served them to the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: They also had a few small fish; and after He had blessed them, He ordered these to be served as well.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they ate and were satisfied; and they picked up seven large baskets full of what was left over of the broken pieces.
speaker: Narrator

text: About four thousand were there; and He sent them away.
speaker: Narrator

text: And immediately He entered the boat with His disciples and came to the district of Dalmanutha.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Pharisees came out and began to argue with Him, seeking from Him a sign from heaven, to test Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sighing deeply in His spirit, He said, “Why does this generation seek for a sign? Truly I say to you, no sign will be given to this generation.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Leaving them, He again embarked and went away to the other side.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they had forgotten to take bread, and did not have more than one loaf in the boat with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He was giving orders to them, saying, “Watch out! Beware of the leaven of the Pharisees and the leaven of Herod.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They began to discuss with one another the fact that they had no bread.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus, aware of this, said to them, “Why do you discuss the fact that you have no bread? Do you not yet see or understand? Do you have a hardened heart?
speaker: Narrator

text: Having eyes, do you not see? And having ears, do you not hear? And do you not remember,
speaker: Narrator

text: when I broke the five loaves for the five thousand, how many baskets full of broken pieces you picked up?” They said to Him, “Twelve.”
speaker: Narrator

text: “When I broke the seven for the four thousand, how many large baskets full of broken pieces did you pick up?” And they said to Him, “Seven.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He was saying to them, “Do you not yet understand?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they came to Bethsaida. And they brought a blind man to Jesus and implored Him to touch him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Taking the blind man by the hand, He brought him out of the village; and after spitting on his eyes and laying His hands on him, He asked him, “Do you see anything?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he looked up and said, “I see men, for I see them like trees, walking around.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then again He laid His hands on his eyes; and he looked intently and was restored, and began to see everything clearly.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He sent him to his home, saying, “Do not even enter the village.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus went out, along with His disciples, to the villages of Caesarea Philippi; and on the way He questioned His disciples, saying to them, “Who do people say that I am?”
speaker: Narrator

text: They told Him, saying, “John the Baptist; and others say Elijah; but others, one of the prophets.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He continued by questioning them, “But who do you say that I am?” Peter answered and said to Him, “You are the Christ.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He warned them to tell no one about Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He began to teach them that the Son of Man must suffer many things and be rejected by the elders and the chief priests and the scribes, and be killed, and after three days rise again.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He was stating the matter plainly. And Peter took Him aside and began to rebuke Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But turning around and seeing His disciples, He rebuked Peter and said, “Get behind Me, Satan; for you are not setting your mind on God’s interests, but man’s.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He summoned the crowd with His disciples, and said to them, “If anyone wishes to come after Me, he must deny himself, and take up his cross and follow Me.
speaker: Narrator

text: For whoever wishes to save his life will lose it, but whoever loses his life for My sake and the gospel’s will save it.
speaker: Narrator

text: For what does it profit a man to gain the whole world, and forfeit his soul?
speaker: Narrator

text: For what will a man give in exchange for his soul?
speaker: Narrator

text: For whoever is ashamed of Me and My words in this adulterous and sinful generation, the Son of Man will also be ashamed of him when He comes in the glory of His Father with the holy angels.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus was saying to them, “Truly I say to you, there are some of those who are standing here who will not taste death until they see the kingdom of God after it has come with power.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Six days later, Jesus took with Him Peter and James and John, and brought them up on a high mountain by themselves. And He was transfigured before them;
speaker: Narrator

text: and His garments became radiant and exceedingly white, as no launderer on earth can whiten them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Elijah appeared to them along with Moses; and they were talking with Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Peter said to Jesus, “Rabbi, it is good for us to be here; let us make three tabernacles, one for You, and one for Moses, and one for Elijah.”
speaker: Narrator

text: For he did not know what to answer; for they became terrified.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then a cloud formed, overshadowing them, and a voice came out of the cloud, “This is My beloved Son, listen to Him!”
speaker: Narrator

text: All at once they looked around and saw no one with them anymore, except Jesus alone.
speaker: Narrator

text: As they were coming down from the mountain, He gave them orders not to relate to anyone what they had seen, until the Son of Man rose from the dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: They seized upon that statement, discussing with one another what rising from the dead meant.
speaker: Narrator

text: They asked Him, saying, “Why is it that the scribes say that Elijah must come first?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said to them, “Elijah does first come and restore all things. And yet how is it written of the Son of Man that He will suffer many things and be treated with contempt?
speaker: Narrator

text: But I say to you that Elijah has indeed come, and they did to him whatever they wished, just as it is written of him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When they came back to the disciples, they saw a large crowd around them, and some scribes arguing with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Immediately, when the entire crowd saw Him, they were amazed and began running up to greet Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He asked them, “What are you discussing with them?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And one of the crowd answered Him, “Teacher, I brought You my son, possessed with a spirit which makes him mute;
speaker: Narrator

text: and whenever it seizes him, it slams him to the ground and he foams at the mouth, and grinds his teeth and stiffens out. I told Your disciples to cast it out, and they could not do it.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He answered them and said, “O unbelieving generation, how long shall I be with you? How long shall I put up with you? Bring him to Me!”
speaker: Narrator

text: They brought the boy to Him. When he saw Him, immediately the spirit threw him into a convulsion, and falling to the ground, he began rolling around and foaming at the mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He asked his father, “How long has this been happening to him?” And he said, “From childhood.
speaker: Narrator

text: It has often thrown him both into the fire and into the water to destroy him. But if You can do anything, take pity on us and help us!”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus said to him, “‘If You can?’ All things are possible to him who believes.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Immediately the boy’s father cried out and said, “I do believe; help my unbelief.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus saw that a crowd was rapidly gathering, He rebuked the unclean spirit, saying to it, “You deaf and mute spirit, I command you, come out of him and do not enter him again.”
speaker: Narrator

text: After crying out and throwing him into terrible convulsions, it came out; and the boy became so much like a corpse that most of them said, “He is dead!”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus took him by the hand and raised him; and he got up.
speaker: Narrator

text: When He came into the house, His disciples began questioning Him privately, “Why could we not drive it out?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said to them, “This kind cannot come out by anything but prayer.”
speaker: Narrator

text: From there they went out and began to go through Galilee, and He did not want anyone to know about it.
speaker: Narrator

text: For He was teaching His disciples and telling them, “The Son of Man is to be delivered into the hands of men, and they will kill Him; and when He has been killed, He will rise three days later.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But they did not understand this statement, and they were afraid to ask Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: They came to Capernaum; and when He was in the house, He began to question them, “What were you discussing on the way?”
speaker: Narrator

text: But they kept silent, for on the way they had discussed with one another which of them was the greatest.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sitting down, He called the twelve and said to them, “If anyone wants to be first, he shall be last of all and servant of all.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Taking a child, He set him before them, and taking him in His arms, He said to them,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Whoever receives one child like this in My name receives Me; and whoever receives Me does not receive Me, but Him who sent Me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: John said to Him, “Teacher, we saw someone casting out demons in Your name, and we tried to prevent him because he was not following us.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus said, “Do not hinder him, for there is no one who will perform a miracle in My name, and be able soon afterward to speak evil of Me.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he who is not against us is for us.
speaker: Narrator

text: For whoever gives you a cup of water to drink because of your name as followers of Christ, truly I say to you, he will not lose his reward.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Whoever causes one of these little ones who believe to stumble, it would be better for him if, with a heavy millstone hung around his neck, he had been cast into the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: If your hand causes you to stumble, cut it off; it is better for you to enter life crippled, than, having your two hands, to go into hell, into the unquenchable fire,
speaker: Narrator

text: [where their worm does not die, and the fire is not quenched.]
speaker: Narrator

text: If your foot causes you to stumble, cut it off; it is better for you to enter life lame, than, having your two feet, to be cast into hell,
speaker: Narrator

text: [where their worm does not die, and the fire is not quenched.]
speaker: Narrator

text: If your eye causes you to stumble, throw it out; it is better for you to enter the kingdom of God with one eye, than, having two eyes, to be cast into hell,
speaker: Narrator

text: where their worm does not die, and the fire is not quenched.
speaker: Narrator

text: “For everyone will be salted with fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: Salt is good; but if the salt becomes unsalty, with what will you make it salty again? Have salt in yourselves, and be at peace with one another.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Getting up, He went from there to the region of Judea and beyond the Jordan; crowds gathered around Him again, and, according to His custom, He once more began to teach them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some Pharisees came up to Jesus, testing Him, and began to question Him whether it was lawful for a man to divorce a wife.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He answered and said to them, “What did Moses command you?”
speaker: Narrator

text: They said, “Moses permitted a man to write a certificate of divorce and send her away.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus said to them, “Because of your hardness of heart he wrote you this commandment.
speaker: Narrator

text: But from the beginning of creation, God made them male and female.
speaker: Narrator

text: For this reason a man shall leave his father and mother,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the two shall become one flesh; so they are no longer two, but one flesh.
speaker: Narrator

text: What therefore God has joined together, let no man separate.”
speaker: Narrator

text: In the house the disciples began questioning Him about this again.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said to them, “Whoever divorces his wife and marries another woman commits adultery against her;
speaker: Narrator

text: and if she herself divorces her husband and marries another man, she is committing adultery.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they were bringing children to Him so that He might touch them; but the disciples rebuked them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when Jesus saw this, He was indignant and said to them, “Permit the children to come to Me; do not hinder them; for the kingdom of God belongs to such as these.
speaker: Narrator

text: Truly I say to you, whoever does not receive the kingdom of God like a child will not enter it at all.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He took them in His arms and began blessing them, laying His hands on them.
speaker: Narrator

text: As He was setting out on a journey, a man ran up to Him and knelt before Him, and asked Him, “Good Teacher, what shall I do to inherit eternal life?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus said to him, “Why do you call Me good? No one is good except God alone.
speaker: Narrator

text: You know the commandments, ‘Do not murder, Do not commit adultery, Do not steal, Do not bear false witness, Do not defraud, Honor your father and mother.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said to Him, “Teacher, I have kept all these things from my youth up.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Looking at him, Jesus felt a love for him and said to him, “One thing you lack: go and sell all you possess and give to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven; and come, follow Me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But at these words he was saddened, and he went away grieving, for he was one who owned much property.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus, looking around, said to His disciples, “How hard it will be for those who are wealthy to enter the kingdom of God!”
speaker: Narrator

text: The disciples were amazed at His words. But Jesus answered again and said to them, “Children, how hard it is to enter the kingdom of God!
speaker: Narrator

text: It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich man to enter the kingdom of God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They were even more astonished and said to Him, “Then who can be saved?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Looking at them, Jesus said, “With people it is impossible, but not with God; for all things are possible with God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Peter began to say to Him, “Behold, we have left everything and followed You.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said, “Truly I say to you, there is no one who has left house or brothers or sisters or mother or father or children or farms, for My sake and for the gospel’s sake,
speaker: Narrator

text: but that he will receive a hundred times as much now in the present age, houses and brothers and sisters and mothers and children and farms, along with persecutions; and in the age to come, eternal life.
speaker: Narrator

text: But many who are first will be last, and the last, first.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They were on the road going up to Jerusalem, and Jesus was walking on ahead of them; and they were amazed, and those who followed were fearful. And again He took the twelve aside and began to tell them what was going to happen to Him,
speaker: Narrator

text: saying, “Behold, we are going up to Jerusalem, and the Son of Man will be delivered to the chief priests and the scribes; and they will condemn Him to death and will hand Him over to the Gentiles.
speaker: Narrator

text: They will mock Him and spit on Him, and scourge Him and kill Him, and three days later He will rise again.”
speaker: Narrator

text: James and John, the two sons of Zebedee, came up to Jesus, saying, “Teacher, we want You to do for us whatever we ask of You.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said to them, “What do you want Me to do for you?”
speaker: Narrator

text: They said to Him, “Grant that we may sit, one on Your right and one on Your left, in Your glory.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus said to them, “You do not know what you are asking. Are you able to drink the cup that I drink, or to be baptized with the baptism with which I am baptized?”
speaker: Narrator

text: They said to Him, “We are able.” And Jesus said to them, “The cup that I drink you shall drink; and you shall be baptized with the baptism with which I am baptized.
speaker: Narrator

text: But to sit on My right or on My left, this is not Mine to give; but it is for those for whom it has been prepared.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Hearing this, the ten began to feel indignant with James and John.
speaker: Narrator

text: Calling them to Himself, Jesus said to them, “You know that those who are recognized as rulers of the Gentiles lord it over them; and their great men exercise authority over them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But it is not this way among you, but whoever wishes to become great among you shall be your servant;
speaker: Narrator

text: and whoever wishes to be first among you shall be slave of all.
speaker: Narrator

text: For even the Son of Man did not come to be served, but to serve, and to give His life a ransom for many.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they came to Jericho. And as He was leaving Jericho with His disciples and a large crowd, a blind beggar named Bartimaeus, the son of Timaeus, was sitting by the road.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he heard that it was Jesus the Nazarene, he began to cry out and say, “Jesus, Son of David, have mercy on me!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Many were sternly telling him to be quiet, but he kept crying out all the more, “Son of David, have mercy on me!”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus stopped and said, “Call him here.” So they called the blind man, saying to him, “Take courage, stand up! He is calling for you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Throwing aside his cloak, he jumped up and came to Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: And answering him, Jesus said, “What do you want Me to do for you?” And the blind man said to Him, “Rabboni, I want to regain my sight!”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus said to him, “Go; your faith has made you well.” Immediately he regained his sight and began following Him on the road.
speaker: Narrator

text: As they approached Jerusalem, at Bethphage and Bethany, near the Mount of Olives, He sent two of His disciples,
speaker: Narrator

text: and said to them, “Go into the village opposite you, and immediately as you enter it, you will find a colt tied there, on which no one yet has ever sat; untie it and bring it here.
speaker: Narrator

text: If anyone says to you, ‘Why are you doing this?’ you say, ‘The Lord has need of it’; and immediately he will send it back here.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They went away and found a colt tied at the door, outside in the street; and they untied it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some of the bystanders were saying to them, “What are you doing, untying the colt?”
speaker: Narrator

text: They spoke to them just as Jesus had told them, and they gave them permission.
speaker: Narrator

text: They brought the colt to Jesus and put their coats on it; and He sat on it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And many spread their coats in the road, and others spread leafy branches which they had cut from the fields.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Blessed is the coming kingdom of our father David;
Hosanna in the highest!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus entered Jerusalem and came into the temple; and after looking around at everything, He left for Bethany with the twelve, since it was already late.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the next day, when they had left Bethany, He became hungry.
speaker: Narrator

text: Seeing at a distance a fig tree in leaf, He went to see if perhaps He would find anything on it; and when He came to it, He found nothing but leaves, for it was not the season for figs.
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to it, “May no one ever eat fruit from you again!” And His disciples were listening.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they came to Jerusalem. And He entered the temple and began to drive out those who were buying and selling in the temple, and overturned the tables of the money changers and the seats of those who were selling doves;
speaker: Narrator

text: and He would not permit anyone to carry merchandise through the temple.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He began to teach and say to them, “Is it not written, ‘My house shall be called a house of prayer for all the nations’? But you have made it a robbers’ den.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The chief priests and the scribes heard this, and began seeking how to destroy Him; for they were afraid of Him, for the whole crowd was astonished at His teaching.
speaker: Narrator

text: When evening came, they would go out of the city.
speaker: Narrator

text: As they were passing by in the morning, they saw the fig tree withered from the roots up.
speaker: Narrator

text: Being reminded, Peter said to Him, “Rabbi, look, the fig tree which You cursed has withered.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus answered saying to them, “Have faith in God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Truly I say to you, whoever says to this mountain, ‘Be taken up and cast into the sea,’ and does not doubt in his heart, but believes that what he says is going to happen, it will be granted him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I say to you, all things for which you pray and ask, believe that you have received them, and they will be granted you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whenever you stand praying, forgive, if you have anything against anyone, so that your Father who is in heaven will also forgive you your transgressions.
speaker: Narrator

text: [But if you do not forgive, neither will your Father who is in heaven forgive your transgressions.”]
speaker: Narrator

text: They came again to Jerusalem. And as He was walking in the temple, the chief priests and the scribes and the elders came to Him,
speaker: Narrator

text: and began saying to Him, “By what authority are You doing these things, or who gave You this authority to do these things?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus said to them, “I will ask you one question, and you answer Me, and then I will tell you by what authority I do these things.
speaker: Narrator

text: Was the baptism of John from heaven, or from men? Answer Me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They began reasoning among themselves, saying, “If we say, ‘From heaven,’ He will say, ‘Then why did you not believe him?’
speaker: Narrator

text: But shall we say, ‘From men’?”—they were afraid of the people, for everyone considered John to have been a real prophet.
speaker: Narrator

text: Answering Jesus, they said, “We do not know.” And Jesus said to them, “Nor will I tell you by what authority I do these things.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He began to speak to them in parables: “A man planted a vineyard and put a wall around it, and dug a vat under the wine press and built a tower, and rented it out to vine-growers and went on a journey.
speaker: Narrator

text: At the harvest time he sent a slave to the vine-growers, in order to receive some of the produce of the vineyard from the vine-growers.
speaker: Narrator

text: They took him, and beat him and sent him away empty-handed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Again he sent them another slave, and they wounded him in the head, and treated him shamefully.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he sent another, and that one they killed; and so with many others, beating some and killing others.
speaker: Narrator

text: He had one more to send, a beloved son; he sent him last of all to them, saying, ‘They will respect my son.’
speaker: Narrator

text: But those vine-growers said to one another, ‘This is the heir; come, let us kill him, and the inheritance will be ours!’
speaker: Narrator

text: They took him, and killed him and threw him out of the vineyard.
speaker: Narrator

text: What will the owner of the vineyard do? He will come and destroy the vine-growers, and will give the vineyard to others.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
This came about from the Lord,
And it is marvelous in our eyes’?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they were seeking to seize Him, and yet they feared the people, for they understood that He spoke the parable against them. And so they left Him and went away.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they sent some of the Pharisees and Herodians to Him in order to trap Him in a statement.
speaker: Narrator

text: They came and said to Him, “Teacher, we know that You are truthful and defer to no one; for You are not partial to any, but teach the way of God in truth. Is it lawful to pay a poll-tax to Caesar, or not?
speaker: Narrator

text: Shall we pay or shall we not pay?” But He, knowing their hypocrisy, said to them, “Why are you testing Me? Bring Me a denarius to look at.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They brought one. And He said to them, “Whose likeness and inscription is this?” And they said to Him, “Caesar’s.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus said to them, “Render to Caesar the things that are Caesar’s, and to God the things that are God’s.” And they were amazed at Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some Sadducees (who say that there is no resurrection) came to Jesus, and began questioning Him, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Teacher, Moses wrote for us that if a man’s brother dies and leaves behind a wife and leaves no child, his brother should marry the wife and raise up children to his brother.
speaker: Narrator

text: There were seven brothers; and the first took a wife, and died leaving no children.
speaker: Narrator

text: The second one married her, and died leaving behind no children; and the third likewise;
speaker: Narrator

text: and so all seven left no children. Last of all the woman died also.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the resurrection, when they rise again, which one’s wife will she be? For all seven had married her.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to them, “Is this not the reason you are mistaken, that you do not understand the Scriptures or the power of God?
speaker: Narrator

text: For when they rise from the dead, they neither marry nor are given in marriage, but are like angels in heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: But regarding the fact that the dead rise again, have you not read in the book of Moses, in the passage about the burning bush, how God spoke to him, saying, ‘I am the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob’?
speaker: Narrator

text: He is not the God of the dead, but of the living; you are greatly mistaken.”
speaker: Narrator

text: One of the scribes came and heard them arguing, and recognizing that He had answered them well, asked Him, “What commandment is the foremost of all?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered, “The foremost is, ‘Hear, O Israel! The Lord our God is one Lord;
speaker: Narrator

text: and you shall love the Lord your God with all your heart, and with all your soul, and with all your mind, and with all your strength.’
speaker: Narrator

text: The second is this, ‘You shall love your neighbor as yourself.’ There is no other commandment greater than these.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The scribe said to Him, “Right, Teacher; You have truly stated that He is One, and there is no one else besides Him;
speaker: Narrator

text: and to love Him with all the heart and with all the understanding and with all the strength, and to love one’s neighbor as himself, is much more than all burnt offerings and sacrifices.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus saw that he had answered intelligently, He said to him, “You are not far from the kingdom of God.” After that, no one would venture to ask Him any more questions.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus began to say, as He taught in the temple, “How is it that the scribes say that the Christ is the son of David?
speaker: Narrator

text:
David himself said in the Holy Spirit,
‘The Lord said to my Lord,
“Sit at My right hand,
Until I put Your enemies beneath Your feet.”’
speaker: Narrator

text: David himself calls Him ‘Lord’; so in what sense is He his son?” And the large crowd enjoyed listening to Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: In His teaching He was saying: “Beware of the scribes who like to walk around in long robes, and like respectful greetings in the market places,
speaker: Narrator

text: and chief seats in the synagogues and places of honor at banquets,
speaker: Narrator

text: who devour widows’ houses, and for appearance’s sake offer long prayers; these will receive greater condemnation.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He sat down opposite the treasury, and began observing how the people were putting money into the treasury; and many rich people were putting in large sums.
speaker: Narrator

text: A poor widow came and put in two small copper coins, which amount to a cent.
speaker: Narrator

text: Calling His disciples to Him, He said to them, “Truly I say to you, this poor widow put in more than all the contributors to the treasury;
speaker: Narrator

text: for they all put in out of their surplus, but she, out of her poverty, put in all she owned, all she had to live on.”
speaker: Narrator

text: As He was going out of the temple, one of His disciples said to Him, “Teacher, behold what wonderful stones and what wonderful buildings!”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus said to him, “Do you see these great buildings? Not one stone will be left upon another which will not be torn down.”
speaker: Narrator

text: As He was sitting on the Mount of Olives opposite the temple, Peter and James and John and Andrew were questioning Him privately,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Tell us, when will these things be, and what will be the sign when all these things are going to be fulfilled?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus began to say to them, “See to it that no one misleads you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Many will come in My name, saying, ‘I am He!’ and will mislead many.
speaker: Narrator

text: When you hear of wars and rumors of wars, do not be frightened; those things must take place; but that is not yet the end.
speaker: Narrator

text: For nation will rise up against nation, and kingdom against kingdom; there will be earthquakes in various places; there will also be famines. These things are merely the beginning of birth pangs.
speaker: Narrator

text: “But be on your guard; for they will deliver you to the courts, and you will be flogged in the synagogues, and you will stand before governors and kings for My sake, as a testimony to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The gospel must first be preached to all the nations.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they arrest you and hand you over, do not worry beforehand about what you are to say, but say whatever is given you in that hour; for it is not you who speak, but it is the Holy Spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Brother will betray brother to death, and a father his child; and children will rise up against parents and have them put to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will be hated by all because of My name, but the one who endures to the end, he will be saved.
speaker: Narrator

text: “But when you see the abomination of desolation standing where it should not be (let the reader understand), then those who are in Judea must flee to the mountains.
speaker: Narrator

text: The one who is on the housetop must not go down, or go in to get anything out of his house;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the one who is in the field must not turn back to get his coat.
speaker: Narrator

text: But woe to those who are pregnant and to those who are nursing babies in those days!
speaker: Narrator

text: But pray that it may not happen in the winter.
speaker: Narrator

text: For those days will be a time of tribulation such as has not occurred since the beginning of the creation which God created until now, and never will.
speaker: Narrator

text: Unless the Lord had shortened those days, no life would have been saved; but for the sake of the elect, whom He chose, He shortened the days.
speaker: Narrator

text: And then if anyone says to you, ‘Behold, here is the Christ’; or, ‘Behold, He is there’; do not believe him;
speaker: Narrator

text: for false Christs and false prophets will arise, and will show signs and wonders, in order to lead astray, if possible, the elect.
speaker: Narrator

text: But take heed; behold, I have told you everything in advance.
speaker: Narrator

text: “But in those days, after that tribulation, the sun will be darkened and the moon will not give its light,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the stars will be falling from heaven, and the powers that are in the heavens will be shaken.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they will see the Son of Man coming in clouds with great power and glory.
speaker: Narrator

text: And then He will send forth the angels, and will gather together His elect from the four winds, from the farthest end of the earth to the farthest end of heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Now learn the parable from the fig tree: when its branch has already become tender and puts forth its leaves, you know that summer is near.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even so, you too, when you see these things happening, recognize that He is near, right at the door.
speaker: Narrator

text: Truly I say to you, this generation will not pass away until all these things take place.
speaker: Narrator

text: Heaven and earth will pass away, but My words will not pass away.
speaker: Narrator

text: But of that day or hour no one knows, not even the angels in heaven, nor the Son, but the Father alone.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Take heed, keep on the alert; for you do not know when the appointed time will come.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is like a man away on a journey, who upon leaving his house and putting his slaves in charge, assigning to each one his task, also commanded the doorkeeper to stay on the alert.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, be on the alert—for you do not know when the master of the house is coming, whether in the evening, at midnight, or when the rooster crows, or in the morning—
speaker: Narrator

text: in case he should come suddenly and find you asleep.
speaker: Narrator

text: What I say to you I say to all, ‘Be on the alert!’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the Passover and Unleavened Bread were two days away; and the chief priests and the scribes were seeking how to seize Him by stealth and kill Him;
speaker: Narrator

text: for they were saying, “Not during the festival, otherwise there might be a riot of the people.”
speaker: Narrator

text: While He was in Bethany at the home of Simon the leper, and reclining at the table, there came a woman with an alabaster vial of very costly perfume of pure nard; and she broke the vial and poured it over His head.
speaker: Narrator

text: But some were indignantly remarking to one another, “Why has this perfume been wasted?
speaker: Narrator

text: For this perfume might have been sold for over three hundred denarii, and the money given to the poor.” And they were scolding her.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus said, “Let her alone; why do you bother her? She has done a good deed to Me.
speaker: Narrator

text: For you always have the poor with you, and whenever you wish you can do good to them; but you do not always have Me.
speaker: Narrator

text: She has done what she could; she has anointed My body beforehand for the burial.
speaker: Narrator

text: Truly I say to you, wherever the gospel is preached in the whole world, what this woman has done will also be spoken of in memory of her.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Judas Iscariot, who was one of the twelve, went off to the chief priests in order to betray Him to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were glad when they heard this, and promised to give him money. And he began seeking how to betray Him at an opportune time.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the first day of Unleavened Bread, when the Passover lamb was being sacrificed, His disciples said to Him, “Where do You want us to go and prepare for You to eat the Passover?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He sent two of His disciples and said to them, “Go into the city, and a man will meet you carrying a pitcher of water; follow him;
speaker: Narrator

text: and wherever he enters, say to the owner of the house, ‘The Teacher says, “Where is My guest room in which I may eat the Passover with My disciples?”’
speaker: Narrator

text: And he himself will show you a large upper room furnished and ready; prepare for us there.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The disciples went out and came to the city, and found it just as He had told them; and they prepared the Passover.
speaker: Narrator

text: When it was evening He came with the twelve.
speaker: Narrator

text: As they were reclining at the table and eating, Jesus said, “Truly I say to you that one of you will betray Me—one who is eating with Me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They began to be grieved and to say to Him one by one, “Surely not I?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said to them, “It is one of the twelve, one who dips with Me in the bowl.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Son of Man is to go just as it is written of Him; but woe to that man by whom the Son of Man is betrayed! It would have been good for that man if he had not been born.”
speaker: Narrator

text: While they were eating, He took some bread, and after a blessing He broke it, and gave it to them, and said, “Take it; this is My body.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And when He had taken a cup and given thanks, He gave it to them, and they all drank from it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said to them, “This is My blood of the covenant, which is poured out for many.
speaker: Narrator

text: Truly I say to you, I will never again drink of the fruit of the vine until that day when I drink it new in the kingdom of God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: After singing a hymn, they went out to the Mount of Olives.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus said to them, “You will all fall away, because it is written, ‘I will strike down the shepherd, and the sheep shall be scattered.’
speaker: Narrator

text: But after I have been raised, I will go ahead of you to Galilee.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Peter said to Him, “Even though all may fall away, yet I will not.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus said to him, “Truly I say to you, that this very night, before a rooster crows twice, you yourself will deny Me three times.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Peter kept saying insistently, “Even if I have to die with You, I will not deny You!” And they all were saying the same thing also.
speaker: Narrator

text: They came to a place named Gethsemane; and He said to His disciples, “Sit here until I have prayed.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He took with Him Peter and James and John, and began to be very distressed and troubled.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said to them, “My soul is deeply grieved to the point of death; remain here and keep watch.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He went a little beyond them, and fell to the ground and began to pray that if it were possible, the hour might pass Him by.
speaker: Narrator
