text: And He was saying, “Abba! Father! All things are possible for You; remove this cup from Me; yet not what I will, but what You will.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And He came and found them sleeping, and said to Peter, “Simon, are you asleep? Could you not keep watch for one hour?
speaker: Narrator

text: Keep watching and praying that you may not come into temptation; the spirit is willing, but the flesh is weak.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Again He went away and prayed, saying the same words.
speaker: Narrator

text: And again He came and found them sleeping, for their eyes were very heavy; and they did not know what to answer Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He came the third time, and said to them, “Are you still sleeping and resting? It is enough; the hour has come; behold, the Son of Man is being betrayed into the hands of sinners.
speaker: Narrator

text: Get up, let us be going; behold, the one who betrays Me is at hand!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Immediately while He was still speaking, Judas, one of the twelve, came up accompanied by a crowd with swords and clubs, who were from the chief priests and the scribes and the elders.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now he who was betraying Him had given them a signal, saying, “Whomever I kiss, He is the one; seize Him and lead Him away under guard.”
speaker: Narrator

text: After coming, Judas immediately went to Him, saying, “Rabbi!” and kissed Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: They laid hands on Him and seized Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But one of those who stood by drew his sword, and struck the slave of the high priest and cut off his ear.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus said to them, “Have you come out with swords and clubs to arrest Me, as you would against a robber?
speaker: Narrator

text: Every day I was with you in the temple teaching, and you did not seize Me; but this has taken place to fulfill the Scriptures.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they all left Him and fled.
speaker: Narrator

text: A young man was following Him, wearing nothing but a linen sheet over his naked body; and they seized him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he pulled free of the linen sheet and escaped naked.
speaker: Narrator

text: They led Jesus away to the high priest; and all the chief priests and the elders and the scribes gathered together.
speaker: Narrator

text: Peter had followed Him at a distance, right into the courtyard of the high priest; and he was sitting with the officers and warming himself at the fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the chief priests and the whole Council kept trying to obtain testimony against Jesus to put Him to death, and they were not finding any.
speaker: Narrator

text: For many were giving false testimony against Him, but their testimony was not consistent.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some stood up and began to give false testimony against Him, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “We heard Him say, ‘I will destroy this temple made with hands, and in three days I will build another made without hands.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Not even in this respect was their testimony consistent.
speaker: Narrator

text: The high priest stood up and came forward and questioned Jesus, saying, “Do You not answer? What is it that these men are testifying against You?”
speaker: Narrator

text: But He kept silent and did not answer. Again the high priest was questioning Him, and saying to Him, “Are You the Christ, the Son of the Blessed One?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus said, “I am; and you shall see the Son of Man sitting at the right hand of Power, and coming with the clouds of heaven.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Tearing his clothes, the high priest said, “What further need do we have of witnesses?
speaker: Narrator

text: You have heard the blasphemy; how does it seem to you?” And they all condemned Him to be deserving of death.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some began to spit at Him, and to blindfold Him, and to beat Him with their fists, and to say to Him, “Prophesy!” And the officers received Him with slaps in the face.
speaker: Narrator

text: As Peter was below in the courtyard, one of the servant-girls of the high priest came,
speaker: Narrator

text: and seeing Peter warming himself, she looked at him and said, “You also were with Jesus the Nazarene.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But he denied it, saying, “I neither know nor understand what you are talking about.” And he went out onto the porch.
speaker: Narrator

text: The servant-girl saw him, and began once more to say to the bystanders, “This is one of them!”
speaker: Narrator

text: But again he denied it. And after a little while the bystanders were again saying to Peter, “Surely you are one of them, for you are a Galilean too.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But he began to curse and swear, “I do not know this man you are talking about!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Immediately a rooster crowed a second time. And Peter remembered how Jesus had made the remark to him, “Before a rooster crows twice, you will deny Me three times.” And he began to weep.
speaker: Narrator

text: Early in the morning the chief priests with the elders and scribes and the whole Council, immediately held a consultation; and binding Jesus, they led Him away and delivered Him to Pilate.
speaker: Narrator

text: Pilate questioned Him, “Are You the King of the Jews?” And He answered him, “It is as you say.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The chief priests began to accuse Him harshly.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Pilate questioned Him again, saying, “Do You not answer? See how many charges they bring against You!”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus made no further answer; so Pilate was amazed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now at the feast he used to release for them any one prisoner whom they requested.
speaker: Narrator

text: The man named Barabbas had been imprisoned with the insurrectionists who had committed murder in the insurrection.
speaker: Narrator

text: The crowd went up and began asking him to do as he had been accustomed to do for them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Pilate answered them, saying, “Do you want me to release for you the King of the Jews?”
speaker: Narrator

text: For he was aware that the chief priests had handed Him over because of envy.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the chief priests stirred up the crowd to ask him to release Barabbas for them instead.
speaker: Narrator

text: Answering again, Pilate said to them, “Then what shall I do with Him whom you call the King of the Jews?”
speaker: Narrator

text: They shouted back, “Crucify Him!”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Pilate said to them, “Why, what evil has He done?” But they shouted all the more, “Crucify Him!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Wishing to satisfy the crowd, Pilate released Barabbas for them, and after having Jesus scourged, he handed Him over to be crucified.
speaker: Narrator

text: The soldiers took Him away into the palace (that is, the Praetorium), and they called together the whole Roman cohort.
speaker: Narrator

text: They dressed Him up in purple, and after twisting a crown of thorns, they put it on Him;
speaker: Narrator

text: and they began to acclaim Him, “Hail, King of the Jews!”
speaker: Narrator

text: They kept beating His head with a reed, and spitting on Him, and kneeling and bowing before Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: After they had mocked Him, they took the purple robe off Him and put His own garments on Him. And they led Him out to crucify Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: They pressed into service a passer-by coming from the country, Simon of Cyrene (the father of Alexander and Rufus), to bear His cross.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they brought Him to the place Golgotha, which is translated, Place of a Skull.
speaker: Narrator

text: They tried to give Him wine mixed with myrrh; but He did not take it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they crucified Him, and divided up His garments among themselves, casting lots for them to decide what each man should take.
speaker: Narrator

text: It was the third hour when they crucified Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The inscription of the charge against Him read, “THE KING OF THE JEWS.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They crucified two robbers with Him, one on His right and one on His left.
speaker: Narrator

text: [And the Scripture was fulfilled which says, “And He was numbered with transgressors.”]
speaker: Narrator

text: Those passing by were hurling abuse at Him, wagging their heads, and saying, “Ha! You who are going to destroy the temple and rebuild it in three days,
speaker: Narrator

text: save Yourself, and come down from the cross!”
speaker: Narrator

text: In the same way the chief priests also, along with the scribes, were mocking Him among themselves and saying, “He saved others; He cannot save Himself.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let this Christ, the King of Israel, now come down from the cross, so that we may see and believe!” Those who were crucified with Him were also insulting Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the sixth hour came, darkness fell over the whole land until the ninth hour.
speaker: Narrator

text: At the ninth hour Jesus cried out with a loud voice, “Eloi, Eloi, lama sabachthani?” which is translated, “My God, My God, why have You forsaken Me?”
speaker: Narrator

text: When some of the bystanders heard it, they began saying, “Behold, He is calling for Elijah.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Someone ran and filled a sponge with sour wine, put it on a reed, and gave Him a drink, saying, “Let us see whether Elijah will come to take Him down.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus uttered a loud cry, and breathed His last.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the veil of the temple was torn in two from top to bottom.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the centurion, who was standing right in front of Him, saw the way He breathed His last, he said, “Truly this man was the Son of God!”
speaker: Narrator

text: There were also some women looking on from a distance, among whom were Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James the Less and Joses, and Salome.
speaker: Narrator

text: When He was in Galilee, they used to follow Him and minister to Him; and there were many other women who came up with Him to Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: When evening had already come, because it was the preparation day, that is, the day before the Sabbath,
speaker: Narrator

text: Joseph of Arimathea came, a prominent member of the Council, who himself was waiting for the kingdom of God; and he gathered up courage and went in before Pilate, and asked for the body of Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Pilate wondered if He was dead by this time, and summoning the centurion, he questioned him as to whether He was already dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: And ascertaining this from the centurion, he granted the body to Joseph.
speaker: Narrator

text: Joseph bought a linen cloth, took Him down, wrapped Him in the linen cloth and laid Him in a tomb which had been hewn out in the rock; and he rolled a stone against the entrance of the tomb.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of Joses were looking on to see where He was laid.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the Sabbath was over, Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James, and Salome, bought spices, so that they might come and anoint Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Very early on the first day of the week, they came to the tomb when the sun had risen.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were saying to one another, “Who will roll away the stone for us from the entrance of the tomb?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Looking up, they saw that the stone had been rolled away, although it was extremely large.
speaker: Narrator

text: Entering the tomb, they saw a young man sitting at the right, wearing a white robe; and they were amazed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said to them, “Do not be amazed; you are looking for Jesus the Nazarene, who has been crucified. He has risen; He is not here; behold, here is the place where they laid Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But go, tell His disciples and Peter, ‘He is going ahead of you to Galilee; there you will see Him, just as He told you.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: They went out and fled from the tomb, for trembling and astonishment had gripped them; and they said nothing to anyone, for they were afraid.
speaker: Narrator

text: [Now after He had risen early on the first day of the week, He first appeared to Mary Magdalene, from whom He had cast out seven demons.
speaker: Narrator

text: She went and reported to those who had been with Him, while they were mourning and weeping.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they heard that He was alive and had been seen by her, they refused to believe it.
speaker: Narrator

text: After that, He appeared in a different form to two of them while they were walking along on their way to the country.
speaker: Narrator

text: They went away and reported it to the others, but they did not believe them either.
speaker: Narrator

text: Afterward He appeared to the eleven themselves as they were reclining at the table; and He reproached them for their unbelief and hardness of heart, because they had not believed those who had seen Him after He had risen.
speaker: Narrator

text: And He said to them, “Go into all the world and preach the gospel to all creation.
speaker: Narrator

text: He who has believed and has been baptized shall be saved; but he who has disbelieved shall be condemned.
speaker: Narrator

text: These signs will accompany those who have believed: in My name they will cast out demons, they will speak with new tongues;
speaker: Narrator

text: they will pick up serpents, and if they drink any deadly poison, it will not hurt them; they will lay hands on the sick, and they will recover.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So then, when the Lord Jesus had spoken to them, He was received up into heaven and sat down at the right hand of God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And they went out and preached everywhere, while the Lord worked with them, and confirmed the word by the signs that followed.]
[And they promptly reported all these instructions to Peter and his companions. And after that, Jesus Himself sent out through them from east to west the sacred and imperishable proclamation of eternal salvation.]
speaker: Narrator
